content.description:
Start matched on the crimp rail at the back of the hole/tube under North Shore. Climb out crimps into the start of North Shore, and finish on that.

It is dabby and not aesthetic at all. There are good moves on perfect rock though....
content.location:
This is the low left start to

The North Shore

.

content.description:
Start on the SW arete above some small blocks, and cruise up and right along a ramp to the same top out as the

V7

.

Just right of

Mavericks

, climb over the boulder that you hope you won't land on. SDS on a perfect jug make long pulls to a slopey topout.
content.protection: A bunch of pads, this problem is a ankle breaker, be careful.
content.location:
This is 2 feet right of

Mavericks

.

content.description:
Climb just left of

Mavericks

. Start on two sloping holds and make a large throw/dead point for a set of sloper jugs, continue on to the finish of

Mavericks

.
content.protection: A good spotter and a crash pad.

content.description: Work up bomber holds via long reaches, then to left hand sidepull, and over the lip. Gneiss rock, classico.
content.location: This ascends the obvious, huge boulder encountered on your way up the gully from the mile marker 268.

content.description:
41st Street is a super classic Clear Creek boulder problem.  Struggle to establish on two underclings, and lurch for a large but strangely hard to use jug.  Get a heel hook, fight through some bad holds, and make a dynamic move to a crack.  Don't relax, because an awkward pinch and a scary mantle wait at the top.

To descend, continue to the top on easy terrain, and downclimb the north side of the boulder.
content.protection: Although this problem isn't a highball, the landing is such that it requires at least two pads and a spotter to safely climb on.
content.location: The only problem on the South side of the Maverick's Boulder, look for two very obvious underclings at chest height.
